Name: Mauryans
History: Founded in 322 B.C. by Chandragupta Maurya, the Mauryan Empire was the first to rule most of the Indian subcontinent, and was one of the largest and most populous empires of antiquity. Its military featured bowmen who used the long-range bamboo longbow, fierce female warriors, chariots, and thousands of armored war elephants. Its philosophers, especially the famous Acharya Chanakya, contributed to such varied fields such as economics, religion, diplomacy, warfare, and good governance. Under the rule of Ashoka the Great, the empire saw 40 years of peace, harmony, and prosperity.

Technologies.Name: Wootz Steel
Technologies.History: The Wootz steel is believed to have originated in India. There are several ancient Greek and Roman literary references to high-quality Indian steel since the time of Alexander's Indian campaign.'

Technologies.Name: Archery Tradition
Technologies.History: India was a land of archery. The bulk of any Indian army was made up of highly skilled archers, armed with bamboo longbows.

Technologies.Name: Pacifism Reform
Technologies.History: In regrets of the bloodshed, having slaughtered many thousands of people in his early reign expeditions, Ashoka started supporting Buddhism and pacifism.
Technologies.Description: Infantry citizen soldiers +15% all gather rates but also 10% less hit points and attack damage.

Heroes.Name: Ashoka the Great
Heroes.History: Last great emperor of the Mauryan dynasty.

Heroes.Name: Acharya Chāṇakya
Heroes.History: Great teacher and advisor to Chandragupta Maurya.

CivBonuses.Name: Emperor of Emperors.
CivBonuses.History: The Mauryan Empire encompassed dozens of formerly independent kingdoms over an area of 5 million square kilometers, with a population of close to 60 million people. The Mauryan regents held the title Emperor of Emperors and commanded a standing army of 600,000 infantry, 9000 elephants, 8000 chariots, and 30,000 cavalry, making it arguably the largest army of its time.
CivBonuses.Description: Mauryans have a +10% population cap bonus (i.e., 330 pop cap instead of the usual 300). Each phase researched reduces the food cost of female and infantry citizens by 10%.

CivBonuses.Name: Light Infantry
CivBonuses.History: The majority of eastern infantrymen were hastely levied unarmored troops.
CivBonuses.Description: Citizen Melee infantry cost -10% wood/metal and train 10% faster but also have -20% hit points and -1 hack and pierce armor levels.

CivBonuses.Name: Wooden Construction
CivBonuses.History: Mauryans structures were mostly made of wood. Consequently, their structures have less health than other cultures do, but they also construct faster.
CivBonuses.Description: Structures construct 20% faster but are also 20% weaker. Walls cost lumber instead of stone.

TeamBonuses.Name: Elephant Abundance.
TeamBonuses.History: India was full of elephants, and the Mauryans often exported or gifted numbers of war elephants to allies.
TeamBonuses.Description: Elephant Units train 20% faster (currently not shared).

Structures.Name: Elephant Stables
Structures.Special: Trains Elephant Archer and Worker Elephant at Town Phase, then adds the champion War Elephant at the City phase.

Structures.Name: Edict Pillar of Ashoka
Structures.Description: Increases the gather rates of nearby units by 10%.
Structures.Requirements: Built by the Ashoka hero unit.
Structures.Special: Contentment: +10% Health and +10% resource gathering rates for all citizens and allied citizens within its range. Can be built anywhere except in enemy territory. Max Built: 10.
